borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<p class="Default"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:#5B9BD5"><i>No
demolition or development shall take place until a written scheme of
investigation (WSI) has been submitted to and approved by the local planning
authority in writing. For land that is included within the WSI, no demolition
or development shall take place other than in accordance with the agreed WSI,
which shall include the statement of significance and research objectives, and <o:p></o:p></i></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><i><span style="color:#5B9BD5;
mso-fareast-language:EN-GB">A. The programme and methodology of site
investigation and recording and the nomination of a competent person(s) or organisation
to undertake the agreed works <o:p></o:p></span></i></p><p class="MsoNormal"><i><span style="color:#5B9BD5;
mso-fareast-language:EN-GB">B. Where appropriate, details of a programme for
delivering related positive public benefits <o:p></o:p></span></i></p><p class="Default">





</p><p class="MsoNormal"><i><span style="color:#5B9BD5;
mso-fareast-language:EN-GB">C. The programme for post-investigation assessment
and subsequent analysis, publication &amp; dissemination and deposition of
resulting material. This part of the condition shall not be discharged until
these elements have been fulfilled in accordance with the programme set out in
the WSI&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></i></p><p class="Default"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">&nbsp;</span></p><p>











</p><p class="Default"><i><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">Reason:&nbsp; The Written Scheme
of Investigation is required prior to commencement of development in order to
safeguard the heritage of the Borough by providing an adequate opportunity to
investigate and excavate archaeological remains on the site, followed by the
subsequent recording of significant remains (including preservation of
important remains) before development is carried out in accordance with
policies BP2 and BP3 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan
Document&nbsp;</span></i></p><p class="Default"><i><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin"><br></span></i><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ascii-theme-font:
minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin"><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="Default"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">No above ground development shall commence until details of bird
nesting and bat roosting bricks/boxes to be incorporated into the structure of
the new building(s) or roof space have been submitted to and approved in
writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall have regard to the
advice set out in 'Biodiversity for Low and Zero Carbon Buildings: A Technical
Guide for New Build' (Published by RIBA, March 2010). Bird nest boxes/bricks
should be provided for swifts, starlings and house sparrows. Additional bird
and bat boxes should be identified on suitable trees. The approved scheme shall
be implemented prior to occupation of the development and permanently retained
thereafter. Minor amendments may be agreed from time to time in writing by the
Local Planning Authority. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="Default"><i><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">&nbsp;</span></i></p><p>



</p><p class="Default"><i><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">Reason: In order to preserve and enhance the Borough's natural
environment and to comply with policy CR2 of the Core Strategy, policy BR3 of
the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document and Policy G6
of the London Plan (2021).<o:p></o:p></span></i></p>

<p class="Default"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">a) Except for the purposes of access and egress entrance/exit
doors are to be kept closed during times when amplified music is being played
within the building. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="Default"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">b) Noise from live and amplified music associated with the use of
the new building shall be controlled so as to be inaudible inside adjoining and
other noise-sensitive premises in the vicinity of the church. The initial test
for compliance with the 'inaudibility' criterion will be that noise should be
no more than barely audible outside those noise-sensitive premises. In the event
there is disagreement as to whether breakout noise from the building is or is
not audible the following numerical limits shall be used to determine
compliance with this condition: <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="Default"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">- the LAeq (PN) shall not exceed LA90 (WPN) and; <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="Default"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">- the L10 (PN) shall not exceed L90 (WPN) in any 1/3 octave band
between 40Hz and 160Hz. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="Default"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">PN = premises noise level, WPN = representative background noise
level without the premises noise, both measured 1 metre from the façade of the
noise-sensitive premises. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="Default"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">&nbsp;</span></p><p>











</p><p class="Default"><i><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">Reason: To ensure that noise-sensitive buildings in the vicinity
of the development are adequately protected from noise and in accordance with
policy BR13 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document
and policy D14 of the London Plan (2021).<o:p></o:p></span></i></p>

<p class="Default" style="margin-left:18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ascii-theme-font:
minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-optical-sizing: auto; font-feature-settings: normal; font-variation-settings: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></span><!--[endif]--><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">The hard and soft landscaping scheme shown on drawing No. CHAD 103 01, insofar as it concerns this application, shall be carried out in the first
planting and seeding seasons following the occupation or the completion of the
development, whichever is the sooner. Any trees or plants which within a period
of 5 years from the completion of the development die, are removed or become
seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next planting season
with others of similar size and species unless the Local Planning Authority
gives written consent to any variation.&nbsp;
An irrigation maintenance programme shall be implemented for the first
two years following planting and a statement shall be submitted to the Local
Planning Authority providing details of the programme and who would be
responsible for carrying it out. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="Default"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">&nbsp;</span></p><p>



</p><p class="Default"><i><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">Reason: To secure the provision and retention of the landscaping
in the interests of the visual amenity of the area and in accordance with
policy BP11 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document.<o:p></o:p></span></i></p>

<p class="Default" style="margin-left: 18pt;">No deliveries, external running of plant and equipment or
construction works, other than internal works not audible outside the site
boundary, shall take place on the site other than between the hours of 0800 to
1800 on Monday to Friday and 0800 to 1300 on Saturday and not at all on
Sundays, Public or Bank Holidays without the prior written permission of the
Local Planning Authority. The works are to be carried out in accordance with
the recommendations contained within British Standard 5228:2009 'Code of
practice for noise and vibration control on construction and open sites' (Parts
1 and 2) and the Mayor of London/London Council's publication 'The control of
dust and emissions from construction and demolition, Best Practice Guidance',
2006. <o:p></o:p></p><p class="Default">&nbsp;</p><p>



</p><p class="Default"><i><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">Reason:&nbsp; To ensure that the
proposed demolition and construction work does not cause nuisance and
disturbance to neighbouring occupiers and in accordance with policy BP8 of the
Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document.<o:p></o:p></span></i></p>

The development hereby approved shall only be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:

- DRAWING XXX REV XX DATED XX
- USE [SHIFT]+[ENTER] FOR REGULAR LINE SPACING
- USE [ENTER] FOR LARGER LINE SPACING

No other drawings or documents apply.
The development hereby permitted shall be commenced before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
subdivision_of_building: Church Hall to the rear of main Church building.
description:
Demolition of church
hall and erection of a two-storey rear extension with additional meeting rooms
in the roof, formation of a new car park and associated storage shed and
landscape works

St Chads Church St Chads Road, Chadwell Heath, Romford, Barking And Dagenham, RM6 6JB
The Vicarage, 5 St Chads Road, Chadwell Heath, Romford, Barking And Dagenham, RM6 6JB
